projectDesc.p: Created by converting TCP files to TEI P5 using tcp2tei.xsl, TEI @ Oxford.

editorialDecl.p: EEBO-TCP is a partnership between the Universities of Michigan and Oxford and the publisher ProQuest to create accurately transcribed and encoded texts based on the image sets published by ProQuest via their Early English Books Online (EEBO) database (http://eebo.chadwyck.com). The general aim of EEBO-TCP is to encode one copy (usually the first edition) of every monographic English-language title published between 1473 and 1700 available in EEBO.

EEBO-TCP aimed to produce large quantities of textual data within the usual project restraints of time and funding, and therefore chose to create diplomatic transcriptions (as opposed to critical editions) with light-touch, mainly structural encoding based on the Text Encoding Initiative (http://www.tei-c.org).

The EEBO-TCP project was divided into two phases. The 25,363 texts created during Phase 1 of the project have been released into the public domain as of 1 January 2015. Anyone can now take and use these texts for their own purposes, but we respectfully request that due credit and attribution is given to their original source.
Users should be aware of the process of creating the TCP texts, and therefore of any assumptions that can be made about the data.

Text selection was based on the New Cambridge Bibliography of English Literature (NCBEL). If an author (or for an anonymous work, the title) appears in NCBEL, then their works are eligible for inclusion. Selection was intended to range over a wide variety of subject areas, to reflect the true nature of the print record of the period. In general, first editions of a works in English were prioritized, although there are a number of works in other languages, notably Latin and Welsh, included and sometimes a second or later edition of a work was chosen if there was a compelling reason to do so.

Image sets were sent to external keying companies for transcription and basic encoding. Quality assurance was then carried out by editorial teams in Oxford and Michigan. 5% (or 5 pages, whichever is the greater) of each text was proofread for accuracy and those which did not meet QA standards were returned to the keyers to be redone. After proofreading, the encoding was enhanced and/or corrected and characters marked as illegible were corrected where possible up to a limit of 100 instances per text. Any remaining illegibles were encoded as <gap>s. Understanding these processes should make clear that, while the overall quality of TCP data is very good, some errors will remain and some readable characters will be marked as illegible. Users should bear in mind that in all likelihood such instances will never have been looked at by a TCP editor.
The texts were encoded and linked to page images in accordance with level 4 of the TEI in Libraries guidelines.

Copies of the texts have been issued variously as SGML (TCP schema; ASCII text with mnemonic sdata character entities); displayable XML (TCP schema; characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or text strings within braces); or lossless XML (TEI P5, characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or TEI g elements).

Full documentation of the original data capture process is available from the Text Creation Partnership web site. All versions of the texts are now archived and freely available for download. See the TCP Download FAQ for detailed information. The TEI P5 versions are also freely available from the TCP Github repository.

div.head: A Catalogue of Fees Established by the Governour and Council At the Humble Request of the ASSEMBLY

table.head: For the Governour.

row.cell: For the great Seal to every Patent for and under 100 Acres,
For 1000 Acres and upwards of Arable Land, for every 100 Acres.
For his Hand and Seal to Letters of Administration,
For a Certificate That a Vessel was built, or belongs to their Majesties Subjects,
For every Certeficate under the Governours Hand and Seal to go beyond Sea,
For a Lisence to purchase Land of the Indians,
For the great Seal to a Confirmation for renewing a Patent,

table.head: The Secretary's FEES.

row.cell: For a Patent for a House, Lot or Confirmation of Land formerly possessed,
For a Patent for New Land, for and under 100 Acres,
And above 100 Acres, 2 s. per hundred Acres more,
For a Patent for a New Township,
For a Confirmation of a Township,
For a Warrant to Survey Land,
For Recording a Will, Inventary, &c. under 24 Lines,
For every Letter of Administration of 100 l. or under,
For the Certificate of a Probate of a Will,
For a Certificate of Letters of Naturalization or Denization;
For a Pass to Europe, of a Ship of 30 Tuns,
For the same to the West-Indies, to pay for the proportion
For a Certificate that a Vessel was built here, and belonging to their Majesties Subjects,
For every Petition to the Governour and Council, and Order thereon,
For a Certificate of any matter under the Governour's Hand and Seal,
For a Lisence to purchase Land of the Indians,
For Copying every thing Recorded in the Secretary's Office, first Sheet containing 24 Lines, eight Words to a Line,
For a Quietus of an Administration,
For every Commission, where there is a Sallary or Fees allowed,

table.head: Fees for the Court of 40 s. or under.

row.cell: For the Jury for the same,

table.head: Fees for the Justices in or out of Sessions.

row.cell: FOR The Justices Clerk for a Bond,
FOR Taking Bayl in Court, or out,
FOR Acknowledging a Deed of Sale,
FOR A Lisence for selling Drink,
FOR The Clerk, for a Bond for the same,

table.head: The Judges and Justices Fees for the Court of Common Pleas.

row.cell: FOR ALl Actions, from 40 Shillings to twenty Pound,
FOR From twenty Pound and upward,
FOR Signing a Bill of Cost,
FOR A Certificate for the same to the Secretary's Office at New-York,

table.head: Fees for the Clark of the Sessions and Common Pleas.

row.cell: FOR F â¢â¢ ing a Declaration,
FOR A Copy of a Declaration if required, every Sheet containing 15 Lines, 8 Words to a Line,
FOR Coppying of the Records, for each Sheet, containing 15 Lines, and eight Words to a Line,
FOR Entry Rule or Order of Court,
FOR Searching the Records within one Year,
FOR Every Year backwards 3 d. more,

table.head: The Sheriffs Fees for the Courts of Sessions and Common Pleas.

row.cell: FOR SErving a Writ, taking into Custody, and Bail Bond, without any pretence for Riding in the County,
FOR Serving an Execution under a hundred Pound,
FOR Serving a Writ of Possession,
FOR Scire faciasâª serving, and Return,
FOR Every Person committed into the common Prison,

table.head: The Cryer or Marshals Fees for the Sessions and Common Pleas.

row.cell: FOR CAlling a Jury, each Cause,
FOR The Person that shall Ring the Bell or beat the Drum, each Action depending in Court,
FOR Every Juryâª man each Action,

table.head: Council and Attorneys Fees.
Fees for the Judges of the Supream Court.

row.cell: FOR TAking Bail on a Capt Corpus,
FOR Allowance, and taking Bail on a Writ of Error,
FOR Taking Bail on a Habe â¢â¢ Corpus,
FOR Acknowledging a Deed to be Inrolled,
FOR Signing a Bill of Costs,
FOR Lisencing a Person be an Atrorney,
FOR All Actions of Debt above 20 to 100 Founds,
FOR One Hundred Pounds and upwards,
FOR All Actions of Assault and Battery, False Imprisonment, Defamation, Actions of Trespass, and all other Personal Actions,
FOR Al â¢ Presentments, Informations, and Indictments in Criminal Matters,

table.head: Clarks Fees for the Supream Court.

row.cell: FOR Copy thereof, if required, each Sheet of 15 Lines, 8 Words to a Line,
FOR Entring all manner of Pleas, per Sheet,
FOR Entring a Verdict and Judgment,
FOR Copy of the Records, for each Sheet,

table.head: The Sheriffs Fees for the Supream Court.

row.cell: FOR Serving a Writ or Capias, taking into Custody, and Bail Bond, without any pretence for Riding in the County,
FOR The Venire, Facias and Return,
FOR Serving an Execution under a hundred Pound,
FOR Serving a Writ a Possession,
FOR Serving a Scire facias, and Return,

table.head: The Marshal or Cryers Fees.
Fees for the Mayors Court,
The Clarks Fees for the Mayor's Court.

row.cell: FOR AN Arrest, Attachment or Summons,
FOR Entring and Recording the Answer,
FOR A Copy thereof, if required,
FOR Reading and Entring a Petition,
FOR A Cope thereof, if required,
A Warrant to summons a Jury, each Action,
FOR Entring and Recording Bargains and Sales of Lands, Houses, Wills, Admmistrations, and other Wittings passed in Court, not above 2 Pages,
FOR Licenses for Inn-keepers, Victuallers and Retailers,
FOR A Subpaena for Witnesses, four, or under,
FOR If more, 3 d. for each Person subpaened,
FOR Entring an Allowance for a Habeas Corpus,
FOR A Copy of the Records, per Sheet,

table.head: The Sheriffs Fees for the Mayors Court.

row.cell: FOR Every Person that shall be arrested and committed to Prison for want of Bail, or not Bailable,
FOR Returning of a Jury in each Cause,
FOR Every Execution that shall be served, if under 100 l.

table.head: The Marshalls Fees.

row.cell: FOR SUmmoning a Jury in each Cause,
FOR Every Prisoner committed to Goal,

table.head: Bell Ringer's Fees.
The Jurys Fees.

row.cell: FOR EVery Cause in the City, for each Man on said Jury,

table.head: Fees to be Received in the Custom-House By their Majesties Collector and Receiver General of the Province of New-York.

row.cell: FOR ENntry of every Ship or other Vessel, burthen sixty Tuns or upwards, inwards or outwards,
FOR Every Post Entry of the same,
FOR Lisence to load or unload,
FOR Every Permit or Warrant of Entry,
FOR Every Post of the same,
FOR Every Certificate of Goods Landed, where Bond is given abroad,
FOR The Jerkin and Clearing the same in or out, and comparing the Merchants Entry, and the Masters Invoice or Outvoice,
FOR A Cocquet, Let-Pass or Transire,

table.head: Ships or other Vessels burthen'd under 60 Tuns, and more than 20. Trading into or out of this Province,

row.cell: FOR EVery Entry in or out,
FOR Lisence to load or unload,
FOR Every Post entry of the same,
FOR A Permit or Warrant of Entry,
FOR Every Post of the same,
FOR Clearing and Jerking the same, &c. in ãâ¦ã ,
FOR A Let-Pass, Cocquet or Transire.

table.head: Sloops or Vessels of 20 Tuns, or under, coming or going out of this Province.

row.cell: FOR FOr every Entry in or out,
FOR Lisence to load or unload,
FOR A Permit or Warrant of Entry,
FOR A Post of the same,
FOR A Jerking and Clearing the same in or out, &c.

table.head: Sloops, &c. Trading within this Province, towards the Sound, Connecticut, up Hudsons River and to East-Jarsey,

row.cell: FOR AN Entry in or out,
FOR Lisence to load or unload,
FOR Permit or Warrant of Entry,

div.p:
Other Fees taken in the Custom-House.
FOr the Sight of every Certificate of Bond given, and entring the same in the Kings Books, 0 2 6
For Cancelling a Bond, filing a Certificate, and making it returned in the Kings Books, 0 2 6
Provided alwayes. That no other Fees shall be taken for or concerning the Naval Office, Tonnage, or the enumerated Commodities, or any other thing which relates to Shipping, upon any pretence whatsoever.

table.head: Clark of the Assemblies Fees.

row.cell: FOR REading and entring every Petition,
FOR Recording said Petition, if required,
FOR The Clarks Attendance on the House, all Committees, and drawing up Resolves, &c. per Diem,
FOR The perusal of any Act, or each Days Minutes,
FOR A Copy of each dayes Minutes,
FOR An Order of the House to the Sergeant at Arms, to bring any Person before the House,
FOR Entring said Order, and Copy,

table.head: The Sergeant at Arms Fees.

row.cell: FOR AN Arrest in the Town,
FOR In the Country for the first ten Miles going and coming,
FOR Every day a Prisoner undischarged,
FOR The Return of an Order,

table.head: The Door-keepers Fees.
The Coroners Fees.

row.cell: FOR VIewing of a dead Body not slain by mis-adventure.

table.head: The Surveyors Fees.

row.cell: FOR SUrveying a piece of Land, if under 100 Acres.
FOR If more, for every day he Surveys,
FOR If he imployes any Person to assist him, per Diem.
FOR Every Lo â¢ of Ground in the Town, not exceeding Three Acres,
FOR If more than three Acres, 2s. per Acre,
FOR Travelling Charges, when he does not survey, per Diem,

table.head: To the Attorney General for Fees.

opener.dateline: City of New-York, September 20. 1693. in the 5th Year of their Majesties Reign.

div.p: THe House of Representatives for Their Majesties Province of New-York, do order, That this Catalogue of Fees be sent up to the Governour and Council, praying his Excellency that. He may establish the same.

closer.signed: By Order of the House of Representatives, James Graham, Speaker.

div.p: Printed and Sold by William Bradford, Printer to Their Majesties, King William and Queen Mary, at the Bible in New-York, 1693.
